choices.A: Assume the data was blended together and wait for feedback.
choices.D: Review the files separately and ensure the blended totals match.
choices.C: Spot check a few numbers to look for inconsistencies.
choices.B: Filter on every column to look for inconsistencies in the data.

discussion.content: I would probably do B. if there is several records.

D. Review the files separately and ensure the blended totals match.

The most efficient way to ensure the data is reported correctly after a merger is to review the data from each company separately and then compare the blended totals. This approach allows the analyst to verify the accuracy and consistency of the merged data by confirming that the combined totals align with the individual datasets. It provides a systematic method for identifying any discrepancies or errors that may have occurred during the blending process, allowing for corrections to be made before the first quarter numbers are reported.

questions.question_text: Company A recently merged with Company B and will be reporting first quarter numbers soon. Prior to the release, an analyst wants to ensure the data was accurately blended together. Which of the following is the MOST efficient way to ensure the data is reported correctly?

Given the following numbers:

7, 2, 3, 3, 5

Which of the following is the mean?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If we apply DISTINCT (Product, Cost), we will keep all unique (Product, Cost) pairs instead of just distinct products. The table already has unique (Product, Cost) pairs, meaning no rows are removed.
So, when we sum all values, we get:
1500+1600+1356+890+745+2008+543=8,642

Selected Answer: D
Let me help solve this step by step.

1) First, I need to apply the DISTINCT function to the data. This will remove duplicates and give us one row per unique product and cost combination:

Ground beef: $1,500
Ground beef: $1,600
Lamb chops: $1,356
Lamb chops: $890
Lamb chops: $745
Crab meat: $2,008
Cow's milk: $543

2) Then, I need to SUM all these costs:
$1,500 + $1,600 + $1,356 + $890 + $745 + $2,008 + $543 = $8,642

Therefore, the final cost of the product after applying DISTINCT and then SUM is $8,642.

The DISTINCT function kept all the unique product-cost combinations (didn't eliminate any rows since each cost was different even for the same product), and then the SUM function added all these costs together.

Selected Answer: B
the answer isA

Selected Answer: D
D is best answer

D is correct. 

Since all the cost values are different, none of the cost values are removed by the DISTINCT functions, so we really only need to find the sum. 1500 + 1600 + 1356 + 890 + 745 + 2008 + 543 = 8642.
How to get to this answer, please?

comments.content: The DISTINCT function removes duplicate values, not different values for the same product.So Summing up all the value its is option D

discussion.content:
The best method to visually examine numerical variables in a dataset and identify outliers is option C: Build a scatter plot of each variable and look for observations that are out of place.

Scatter plots provide a visual representation of the relationship between two variables, making it easier to identify any data points that deviate significantly from the overall pattern. Outliers appear as data points that are distant from the bulk of the data points in the scatter plot.

Options A and B may provide some insight into the data, but they are not specifically designed to identify outliers. Option D, ordering each variable and looking for unusual numbers, is not as effective as visual methods like scatter plots for identifying outliers, as it may not capture the complex relationships between variables.

choices.D: Order each variable in a spreadsheet from lowest to highest and look for unusual numbers at the beginning or at the end of the list.
choices.C: Build a scatter plot of each variable and look for observations that are out of place.
choices.B: Create a bar chart for each variable and look for any distributions that are unusual.
choices.A: Plot the linear correlations between each pair of variables and look for unusual relationships

questions.question_text: A market research firm has data sets based on surveys. A data analyst wants to know if any outliers are present in a data set. Which of the following would be the BEST method to examine the numerical variables in the data set visually and find any outliers?
A staff member is analyzing open-ended customer comments from an email survey. Which of the following is the EASIEST way to visualize the data?

discussion.content:
The easiest way to visualize open-ended customer comments from an email survey would be option B: A word cloud.

Word clouds provide a quick and intuitive way to visualize the frequency of words or phrases within a text dataset. The size of each word or phrase in the word cloud is proportional to its frequency in the dataset, making it easy to identify the most commonly occurring terms at a glance.

Options A, C, and D may also be used to visualize text data, but they require more processing and interpretation compared to a word cloud, which offers a straightforward representation of word frequencies.
